name: 陳維昌
objective: Orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) and multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) are popular transmission techniques for wireless and mobile communications, because they offer several advantages such as increasing transmission data rate and enhancing error performance. In the class, we will learn about the basic principles and some advanced topics of OFDM and MIMO. We will also learn how to write a MATLAB program to evaluate the performance of a communication system. All students taking this class have to study a special topic on OFDM or MIMO as a final project.
schedule:
Week 01. Elements of digital communication system
Week 02. Probability and random variables
Week 03. Detection theory and estimation theory
Week 04. OFDM: Signal model, orthogonality, spectral efficiency and efficient implementation
Week 05. OFDM: How to combat with multipath channel
Week 06. OFDM: Synchronization and channel estimation
Week 07. OFDM: OFDM variants I
Week 08. OFDM: OFDM variants II
Week 09. MATLAB
Week 10. OFDM: Power allocation
Week 11. OFDM: PAPR problem and PAPR reduction techniques 
Week 12. OFDM: Large OOB emission problem and OOB emission reduction techniques
Week 13. MIMO: Error performance in fading channels, maximal ratio combining, and selection combining. 
Week 14. MIMO: Space-time block code and spatial precoding 
Week 15. MIMO: Spatial multiplexing and spatial modulation 
Week 16. Massive MIMO
Week 17. Final Exam 
Week 18. Student Oral Presentation 

The schedule may be adjusted if necessary.
scorePolicy:
MATLAB  Homework     30%
Final Exam           40%
Special Topic Report 30%
materials:
Lecture notes

References:
1. Y.-P. Lin, S.-M. Phoong, P. P. Vaidyanathan, Filter Bank Transceivers for OFDM and DMT Systems, Cambridge University Press, 2010. 
2. T. D. Chiueh, P. Y. Tsai, and I. W. Lai, Baseband Receiver Design for Wireless MIMO-OFDM Communications, 2nd ed., Wiley Inc., 2012.
3. D. Tse and P. Viswanath, Fundamentals of Wireless Communication, Cambridge university press, 2005.
